required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Real World Experiences of the iNAP® Lite in OSA Adults in Taiwan
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Observational, Post-market Surveillance Study to Evaluate the Long-term Safety and Efficacy of the iNAP® Sleep Therapy System in Adults With Obstructive Sleep Apnea

brief_summary.textblock: A Prospective, Observational, Post-market Surveillance Study to Evaluate the Long-term Safety and Efficacy of the iNAP® Lite Sleep Therapy System in Adults with Obstructive Sleep Apnea

detailed_description.textblock: Obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) impacts sleep quality of patients, which contributes significantly to hypertension, stroke, myocardial infarction and other health problems. Intraoral devices, such as tongue retaining devices, palatal lifting devices and mandibular repositioning devices designed to increase the patency of the airway and to decrease airway obstruction, are used to treat OSA. To this end, we are conducting a prospective, observational, post-market surveillance study to evaluate the long-term safety and efficacy of the iNAP® Lite sleep therapy system (iNAP® Lite), a tongue and soft palate retaining intraoral device, in adults with OSA.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with adverse events in this entire study.
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, up to 10 weeks
primary_outcome.description: All safety events will be listed and tabulated for their occurrence rate

secondary_outcome.time_frame: a treated polysomnography or polygraphy assessment night
secondary_outcome.description: AHI is the number of apnea/hypopnea events divided by total sleep time (TST), i.e., the number of hours of sleep. Clinical success rate is defined as the proportion of patients in the PP cohort with an AHI reduction of >50% and treated AHI <20 on the Tx PSG Study when compared with the baseline

intervention.description: Class II intraoral devices for snoring and/or obstructive sleep apnea

study_pop.textblock: Adults with obstructive sleep apnea in Taiwan

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed with OSA with AHI>5
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with central sleep apnea (CSA).
- Patients with have severe respiratory disorders such as pulmonary diseases, pneumothorax, etc.
- Patients with loose teeth or advanced periodontal disease.
- Patients with pathologically low blood pressure.

facility.name: Shin Kong Wu Ho-Su Memorial Hospital

patient_data.ipd_description: May or may not share the results in a publication.
